00059 /* Util macros */
00060 #define OUT_OF_MEMORY() ((void)printf("Shrinkwrap: Out of memory\n"))
00061 
00062 /* Benchmark macros */
00063 #if !defined(_WIN32) && 0
00064 
00065 #include <sys/time.h>
00066 
00067 #define BENCH(a)    \
00068     do {            \
00069         double _t1, _t2;                \
00070         struct timeval _tstart, _tend;  \
00071         clock_t _clock_init = clock();  \
00072         gettimeofday ( &_tstart, NULL); \
00073         (a);                            \
00074         gettimeofday ( &_tend, NULL);   \
00075         _t1 = ( double ) _tstart.tv_sec + ( double ) _tstart.tv_usec/ ( 1000*1000 );    \
00076         _t2 = ( double )   _tend.tv_sec + ( double )   _tend.tv_usec/ ( 1000*1000 );    \
00077         printf("%s: %fs (real) %fs (cpu)\n", #a, _t2-_t1, (float)(clock()-_clock_init)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC);\
00078     } while (0)
00079 
00080 #else
00081 
00082 #define BENCH(a)    (a)
00083 
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 typedef void ( *Shrinkwrap_ForeachVertexCallback) (DerivedMesh *target, float *co, float *normal);

00088 /* get derived mesh */
00089 //TODO is anyfunction that does this? returning the derivedFinal without we caring if its in edit mode or not?
00090 DerivedMesh *object_get_derived_final(Object *ob)
00091 {
00092     Mesh *me= ob->data;
00093     BMEditMesh *em = me->edit_btmesh;
00094 
00095     if (em) {
00096         DerivedMesh *dm = em->derivedFinal;
00097         return dm;
00098     }
00099 
00100     return ob->derivedFinal;
00101 }
00102 
00103 /* Space transform */
00104 void space_transform_from_matrixs(SpaceTransform *data, float local[4][4], float target[4][4])
00105 {
00106     float itarget[4][4];
00107     invert_m4_m4(itarget, target);
00108     mul_serie_m4(data->local2target, itarget, local, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00109     invert_m4_m4(data->target2local, data->local2target);
00110 }
00111 
00112 void space_transform_apply(const SpaceTransform *data, float *co)
00113 {
00114     mul_v3_m4v3(co, ((SpaceTransform*)data)->local2target, co);
00115 }
00116 
00117 void space_transform_invert(const SpaceTransform *data, float *co)
00118 {
00119     mul_v3_m4v3(co, ((SpaceTransform*)data)->target2local, co);
00120 }
00121 
00122 static void space_transform_apply_normal(const SpaceTransform *data, float *no)
00123 {
00124     mul_mat3_m4_v3( ((SpaceTransform*)data)->local2target, no);
00125     normalize_v3(no); // TODO: could we just determine de scale value from the matrix?
00126 }
00127 
00128 static void space_transform_invert_normal(const SpaceTransform *data, float *no)
00129 {
00130     mul_mat3_m4_v3(((SpaceTransform*)data)->target2local, no);
00131     normalize_v3(no); // TODO: could we just determine de scale value from the matrix?
00132 }
00133 
00134 /*
00135  * Shrinkwrap to the nearest vertex
00136  *
00137  * it builds a kdtree of vertexs we can attach to and then
00138  * for each vertex performs a nearest vertex search on the tree
00139  */
00140 static void shrinkwrap_calc_nearest_vertex(ShrinkwrapCalcData *calc)
00141 {
00142     int i;
00143 
00144     BVHTreeFromMesh treeData = NULL_BVHTreeFromMesh;
00145     BVHTreeNearest  nearest  = NULL_BVHTreeNearest;
00146 
00147 
00148     BENCH(bvhtree_from_mesh_verts(&treeData, calc->target, 0.0, 2, 6));
00149     if (treeData.tree == NULL)
00150     {
00151         OUT_OF_MEMORY();
00152         return;
00153     }
00154 
00155     //Setup nearest
00156     nearest.index = -1;
00157     nearest.dist = FLT_MAX;
00158 #ifndef __APPLE__
00159 #pragma omp parallel for default(none) private(i) firstprivate(nearest) shared(treeData,calc) schedule(static)
00160 #endif
00161     for (i = 0; i<calc->numVerts; ++i)
00162     {
00163         float *co = calc->vertexCos[i];
00164         float tmp_co[3];
00165         float weight = defvert_array_find_weight_safe(calc->dvert, i, calc->vgroup);
00166         if (weight == 0.0f) continue;
00167 
00168 
00169         //Convert the vertex to tree coordinates
00170         if (calc->vert) {
00171             copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, calc->vert[i].co);
00172         }
00173         else {
00174             copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, co);
00175         }
00176         space_transform_apply(&calc->local2target, tmp_co);
00177 
00178         //Use local proximity heuristics (to reduce the nearest search)
00179         //
00180         //If we already had an hit before.. we assume this vertex is going to have a close hit to that other vertex
00181         //so we can initiate the "nearest.dist" with the expected value to that last hit.
00182         //This will lead in prunning of the search tree.
00183         if (nearest.index != -1)
00184             nearest.dist = len_squared_v3v3(tmp_co, nearest.co);
00185         else
00186             nearest.dist = FLT_MAX;
00187 
00188         BLI_bvhtree_find_nearest(treeData.tree, tmp_co, &nearest, treeData.nearest_callback, &treeData);
00189 
00190 
00191         //Found the nearest vertex
00192         if (nearest.index != -1)
00193         {
00194             //Adjusting the vertex weight, so that after interpolating it keeps a certain distance from the nearest position
00195             float dist = sasqrt(nearest.dist);
00196             if (dist > FLT_EPSILON) weight *= (dist - calc->keepDist)/dist;
00197 
00198             //Convert the coordinates back to mesh coordinates
00199             copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, nearest.co);
00200             space_transform_invert(&calc->local2target, tmp_co);
00201 
00202             interp_v3_v3v3(co, co, tmp_co, weight); //linear interpolation
00203         }
00204     }
00205 
00206     free_bvhtree_from_mesh(&treeData);
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*
00210  * This function raycast a single vertex and updates the hit if the "hit" is considered valid.
00211  * Returns TRUE if "hit" was updated.
00212  * Opts control whether an hit is valid or not
00213  * Supported options are:
00214  *  MOD_SHRINKWRAP_CULL_TARGET_FRONTFACE (front faces hits are ignored)
00215  *  MOD_SHRINKWRAP_CULL_TARGET_BACKFACE (back faces hits are ignored)
00216  */
00217 int normal_projection_project_vertex(char options, const float *vert, const float *dir, const SpaceTransform *transf, BVHTree *tree, BVHTreeRayHit *hit, BVHTree_RayCastCallback callback, void *userdata)
00218 {
00219     float tmp_co[3], tmp_no[3];
00220     const float *co, *no;
00221     BVHTreeRayHit hit_tmp;
00222 
00223     //Copy from hit (we need to convert hit rays from one space coordinates to the other
00224     memcpy( &hit_tmp, hit, sizeof(hit_tmp) );
00225 
00226     //Apply space transform (TODO readjust dist)
00227     if (transf)
00228     {
00229         copy_v3_v3( tmp_co, vert );
00230         space_transform_apply( transf, tmp_co );
00231         co = tmp_co;
00232 
00233         copy_v3_v3( tmp_no, dir );
00234         space_transform_apply_normal( transf, tmp_no );
00235         no = tmp_no;
00236 
00237         hit_tmp.dist *= mat4_to_scale( ((SpaceTransform*)transf)->local2target );
00238     }
00239     else {
00240         co = vert;
00241         no = dir;
00242     }
00243 
00244     hit_tmp.index = -1;
00245 
00246     BLI_bvhtree_ray_cast(tree, co, no, 0.0f, &hit_tmp, callback, userdata);
00247 
00248     if (hit_tmp.index != -1) {
00249         /* invert the normal first so face culling works on rotated objects */
00250         if (transf) {
00251             space_transform_invert_normal(transf, hit_tmp.no);
00252         }
00253 
00254         if (options & (MOD_SHRINKWRAP_CULL_TARGET_FRONTFACE|MOD_SHRINKWRAP_CULL_TARGET_BACKFACE)) {
00255             /* apply backface */
00256             const float dot= dot_v3v3(dir, hit_tmp.no);
00257             if (    ((options & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_CULL_TARGET_FRONTFACE) && dot <= 0.0f) ||
00258                 ((options & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_CULL_TARGET_BACKFACE) && dot >= 0.0f)
00259             ) {
00260                 return FALSE; /* Ignore hit */
00261             }
00262         }
00263 
00264         if (transf) {
00265             /* Inverting space transform (TODO make coeherent with the initial dist readjust) */
00266             space_transform_invert(transf, hit_tmp.co);
00267             hit_tmp.dist = len_v3v3((float *)vert, hit_tmp.co);
00268         }
00269 
00270         memcpy(hit, &hit_tmp, sizeof(hit_tmp) );
00271         return TRUE;
00272     }
00273     return FALSE;
00274 }
00275 
00276 
00277 static void shrinkwrap_calc_normal_projection(ShrinkwrapCalcData *calc)
00278 {
00279     int i;
00280 
00281     //Options about projection direction
00282     const char use_normal   = calc->smd->shrinkOpts;
00283     float proj_axis[3]      = {0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
00284 
00285     //Raycast and tree stuff
00286     BVHTreeRayHit hit;
00287     BVHTreeFromMesh treeData= NULL_BVHTreeFromMesh;
00288 
00289     //auxiliary target
00290     DerivedMesh *auxMesh    = NULL;
00291     BVHTreeFromMesh auxData = NULL_BVHTreeFromMesh;
00292     SpaceTransform local2aux;
00293 
00294     //If the user doesn't allows to project in any direction of projection axis
00295     //then theres nothing todo.
00296     if ((use_normal & (MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_ALLOW_POS_DIR | MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_ALLOW_NEG_DIR)) == 0)
00297         return;
00298 
00299 
00300     //Prepare data to retrieve the direction in which we should project each vertex
00301     if (calc->smd->projAxis == MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_OVER_NORMAL)
00302     {
00303         if (calc->vert == NULL) return;
00304     }
00305     else {
00306         //The code supports any axis that is a combination of X,Y,Z
00307         //although currently UI only allows to set the 3 different axis
00308         if (calc->smd->projAxis & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_OVER_X_AXIS) proj_axis[0] = 1.0f;
00309         if (calc->smd->projAxis & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_OVER_Y_AXIS) proj_axis[1] = 1.0f;
00310         if (calc->smd->projAxis & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_OVER_Z_AXIS) proj_axis[2] = 1.0f;
00311 
00312         normalize_v3(proj_axis);
00313 
00314         //Invalid projection direction
00315         if (dot_v3v3(proj_axis, proj_axis) < FLT_EPSILON)
00316             return; 
00317     }
00318 
00319     if (calc->smd->auxTarget)
00320     {
00321         auxMesh = object_get_derived_final(calc->smd->auxTarget);
00322         if (!auxMesh)
00323             return;
00324         space_transform_setup( &local2aux, calc->ob, calc->smd->auxTarget);
00325     }
00326 
00327     //After sucessufuly build the trees, start projection vertexs
00328     if (bvhtree_from_mesh_faces(&treeData, calc->target, 0.0, 4, 6) &&
00329         (auxMesh == NULL || bvhtree_from_mesh_faces(&auxData, auxMesh, 0.0, 4, 6)))
00330     {
00331 
00332 #ifndef __APPLE__
00333 #pragma omp parallel for private(i,hit) schedule(static)
00334 #endif
00335         for (i = 0; i<calc->numVerts; ++i)
00336         {
00337             float *co = calc->vertexCos[i];
00338             float tmp_co[3], tmp_no[3];
00339             float weight = defvert_array_find_weight_safe(calc->dvert, i, calc->vgroup);
00340 
00341             if (weight == 0.0f) continue;
00342 
00343             if (calc->vert)
00344             {
00345                 /* calc->vert contains verts from derivedMesh  */
00346                 /* this coordinated are deformed by vertexCos only for normal projection (to get correct normals) */
00347                 /* for other cases calc->varts contains undeformed coordinates and vertexCos should be used */
00348                 if (calc->smd->projAxis == MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_OVER_NORMAL) {
00349                     copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, calc->vert[i].co);
00350                     normal_short_to_float_v3(tmp_no, calc->vert[i].no);
00351                 }
00352                 else {
00353                     copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, co);
00354                     copy_v3_v3(tmp_no, proj_axis);
00355                 }
00356             }
00357             else {
00358                 copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, co);
00359                 copy_v3_v3(tmp_no, proj_axis);
00360             }
00361 
00362 
00363             hit.index = -1;
00364             hit.dist = 10000.0f; //TODO: we should use FLT_MAX here, but sweepsphere code isn't prepared for that
00365 
00366             //Project over positive direction of axis
00367             if (use_normal & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_ALLOW_POS_DIR)
00368             {
00369 
00370                 if (auxData.tree)
00371                     normal_projection_project_vertex(0, tmp_co, tmp_no, &local2aux, auxData.tree, &hit, auxData.raycast_callback, &auxData);
00372 
00373                 normal_projection_project_vertex(calc->smd->shrinkOpts, tmp_co, tmp_no, &calc->local2target, treeData.tree, &hit, treeData.raycast_callback, &treeData);
00374             }
00375 
00376             //Project over negative direction of axis
00377             if (use_normal & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT_ALLOW_NEG_DIR && hit.index == -1)
00378             {
00379                 float inv_no[3];
00380                 negate_v3_v3(inv_no, tmp_no);
00381 
00382                 if (auxData.tree)
00383                     normal_projection_project_vertex(0, tmp_co, inv_no, &local2aux, auxData.tree, &hit, auxData.raycast_callback, &auxData);
00384 
00385                 normal_projection_project_vertex(calc->smd->shrinkOpts, tmp_co, inv_no, &calc->local2target, treeData.tree, &hit, treeData.raycast_callback, &treeData);
00386             }
00387 
00388 
00389             if (hit.index != -1)
00390             {
00391                 madd_v3_v3v3fl(hit.co, hit.co, tmp_no, calc->keepDist);
00392                 interp_v3_v3v3(co, co, hit.co, weight);
00393             }
00394         }
00395     }
00396 
00397     //free data structures
00398     free_bvhtree_from_mesh(&treeData);
00399     free_bvhtree_from_mesh(&auxData);
00400 }
00401 
00402 /*
00403  * Shrinkwrap moving vertexs to the nearest surface point on the target
00404  *
00405  * it builds a BVHTree from the target mesh and then performs a
00406  * NN matches for each vertex
00407  */
00408 static void shrinkwrap_calc_nearest_surface_point(ShrinkwrapCalcData *calc)
00409 {
00410     int i;
00411 
00412     BVHTreeFromMesh treeData = NULL_BVHTreeFromMesh;
00413     BVHTreeNearest  nearest  = NULL_BVHTreeNearest;
00414 
00415     //Create a bvh-tree of the given target
00416     BENCH(bvhtree_from_mesh_faces( &treeData, calc->target, 0.0, 2, 6));
00417     if (treeData.tree == NULL)
00418     {
00419         OUT_OF_MEMORY();
00420         return;
00421     }
00422 
00423     //Setup nearest
00424     nearest.index = -1;
00425     nearest.dist = FLT_MAX;
00426 
00427 
00428     //Find the nearest vertex
00429 #ifndef __APPLE__
00430 #pragma omp parallel for default(none) private(i) firstprivate(nearest) shared(calc,treeData) schedule(static)
00431 #endif
00432     for (i = 0; i<calc->numVerts; ++i)
00433     {
00434         float *co = calc->vertexCos[i];
00435         float tmp_co[3];
00436         float weight = defvert_array_find_weight_safe(calc->dvert, i, calc->vgroup);
00437         if (weight == 0.0f) continue;
00438 
00439         //Convert the vertex to tree coordinates
00440         if (calc->vert) {
00441             copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, calc->vert[i].co);
00442         }
00443         else {
00444             copy_v3_v3(tmp_co, co);
00445         }
00446         space_transform_apply(&calc->local2target, tmp_co);
00447 
00448         //Use local proximity heuristics (to reduce the nearest search)
00449         //
00450         //If we already had an hit before.. we assume this vertex is going to have a close hit to that other vertex
00451         //so we can initiate the "nearest.dist" with the expected value to that last hit.
00452         //This will lead in prunning of the search tree.
00453         if (nearest.index != -1)
00454             nearest.dist = len_squared_v3v3(tmp_co, nearest.co);
00455         else
00456             nearest.dist = FLT_MAX;
00457 
00458         BLI_bvhtree_find_nearest(treeData.tree, tmp_co, &nearest, treeData.nearest_callback, &treeData);
00459 
00460         //Found the nearest vertex
00461         if (nearest.index != -1)
00462         {
00463             if (calc->smd->shrinkOpts & MOD_SHRINKWRAP_KEEP_ABOVE_SURFACE)
00464             {
00465                 //Make the vertex stay on the front side of the face
00466                 madd_v3_v3v3fl(tmp_co, nearest.co, nearest.no, calc->keepDist);
00467             }
00468             else {
00469                 //Adjusting the vertex weight, so that after interpolating it keeps a certain distance from the nearest position
00470                 float dist = sasqrt( nearest.dist );
00471                 if (dist > FLT_EPSILON)
00472                     interp_v3_v3v3(tmp_co, tmp_co, nearest.co, (dist - calc->keepDist)/dist);   //linear interpolation
00473                 else
00474                     copy_v3_v3( tmp_co, nearest.co );
00475             }
00476 
00477             //Convert the coordinates back to mesh coordinates
00478             space_transform_invert(&calc->local2target, tmp_co);
00479             interp_v3_v3v3(co, co, tmp_co, weight); //linear interpolation
00480         }
00481     }
00482 
00483     free_bvhtree_from_mesh(&treeData);
00484 }
00485 
00486 /* Main shrinkwrap function */
00487 void shrinkwrapModifier_deform(ShrinkwrapModifierData *smd, Object *ob, DerivedMesh *dm, float (*vertexCos)[3], int numVerts)
00488 {
00489 
00490     DerivedMesh *ss_mesh    = NULL;
00491     ShrinkwrapCalcData calc = NULL_ShrinkwrapCalcData;
00492 
00493     //remove loop dependencies on derived meshs (TODO should this be done elsewhere?)
00494     if (smd->target == ob) smd->target = NULL;
00495     if (smd->auxTarget == ob) smd->auxTarget = NULL;
00496 
00497 
00498     //Configure Shrinkwrap calc data
00499     calc.smd = smd;
00500     calc.ob = ob;
00501     calc.numVerts = numVerts;
00502     calc.vertexCos = vertexCos;
00503 
00504     //DeformVertex
00505     calc.vgroup = defgroup_name_index(calc.ob, calc.smd->vgroup_name);
00506     if (dm) {
00507         calc.dvert = dm->getVertDataArray(dm, CD_MDEFORMVERT);
00508     }
00509     else if (calc.ob->type == OB_LATTICE) {
00510         calc.dvert = lattice_get_deform_verts(calc.ob);
00511     }
00512 
00513 
00514     if (smd->target)
00515     {
00516         calc.target = object_get_derived_final(smd->target);
00517 
00518         //TODO there might be several "bugs" on non-uniform scales matrixs
00519         //because it will no longer be nearest surface, not sphere projection
00520         //because space has been deformed
00521         space_transform_setup(&calc.local2target, ob, smd->target);
00522 
00523         //TODO: smd->keepDist is in global units.. must change to local
00524         calc.keepDist = smd->keepDist;
00525     }
00526 
00527 
00528 
00529     calc.vgroup = defgroup_name_index(calc.ob, smd->vgroup_name);
00530 
00531     if (dm != NULL && smd->shrinkType == MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT)
00532     {
00533         //Setup arrays to get vertexs positions, normals and deform weights
00534         calc.vert   = dm->getVertDataArray(dm, CD_MVERT);
00535         calc.dvert  = dm->getVertDataArray(dm, CD_MDEFORMVERT);
00536 
00537         //Using vertexs positions/normals as if a subsurface was applied 
00538         if (smd->subsurfLevels)
00539         {
00540             SubsurfModifierData ssmd= {{NULL}};
00541             ssmd.subdivType = ME_CC_SUBSURF;        //catmull clark
00542             ssmd.levels     = smd->subsurfLevels;   //levels
00543 
00544             ss_mesh = subsurf_make_derived_from_derived(dm, &ssmd, FALSE, NULL, 0, 0, (ob->mode & OB_MODE_EDIT));
00545 
00546             if (ss_mesh)
00547             {
00548                 calc.vert = ss_mesh->getVertDataArray(ss_mesh, CD_MVERT);
00549                 if (calc.vert)
00550                 {
00551                     //TRICKY: this code assumes subsurface will have the transformed original vertices
00552                     //in their original order at the end of the vert array.
00553                     calc.vert = calc.vert + ss_mesh->getNumVerts(ss_mesh) - dm->getNumVerts(dm);
00554                 }
00555             }
00556 
00557             //Just to make sure we are not leaving any memory behind
00558             assert(ssmd.emCache == NULL);
00559             assert(ssmd.mCache == NULL);
00560         }
00561     }
00562 
00563     //Projecting target defined - lets work!
00564     if (calc.target) {
00565         switch(smd->shrinkType)
00566         {
00567             case MOD_SHRINKWRAP_NEAREST_SURFACE:
00568                 BENCH(shrinkwrap_calc_nearest_surface_point(&calc));
00569             break;
00570 
00571             case MOD_SHRINKWRAP_PROJECT:
00572                 BENCH(shrinkwrap_calc_normal_projection(&calc));
00573             break;
00574 
00575             case MOD_SHRINKWRAP_NEAREST_VERTEX:
00576                 BENCH(shrinkwrap_calc_nearest_vertex(&calc));
00577             break;
00578         }
00579     }
00580 
00581     //free memory
00582     if (ss_mesh)
00583         ss_mesh->release(ss_mesh);
00584 }
00585
